meanings.definition: The state of being reserved or reluctant to speak.
meanings.sent1: Her reticency in class often made her seem shy.
meanings.sent2: His reticency during the meeting was noticeable to everyone.
meanings.sent3: Despite his reticency, he managed to convey his thoughts through gestures.
meanings.sent4: The reticency of the old house gave it an air of mystery.
meanings.sent5: The reticency of the cat added to its enigmatic charm.

meanings.definition: The quality of being silent or uncommunicative.
meanings.sent1: The reticency of the library was soothing to her tired mind.
meanings.sent2: His reticency in social gatherings often led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The reticency of the lake at night was both eerie and calming.
meanings.sent4: The reticency of the forest enveloped them in a blanket of peace.
meanings.sent5: The reticency of the painting left viewers in contemplative silence.

meanings.definition: The act of withholding information or feelings.
meanings.sent1: Her reticency about her past only fueled their curiosity.
meanings.sent2: His reticency in sharing his emotions made it hard for others to understand him.
meanings.sent3: The detective's reticency about the case kept everyone on edge.
meanings.sent4: The reticency of the author added layers of intrigue to the novel.
meanings.sent5: The reticency of the clouds hinted at an impending storm.
